thread.title: Rex, a Denver sheriff’s bomb-sniffing dog, retires
thread.title_full: Rex, a Denver sheriff’s bomb-sniffing dog, retires

author: Kieran Nicholson
title: Rex, a Denver sheriff’s bomb-sniffing dog, retires
text: Owner of The Fort restaurant inducted into hall of fame, has big plans for tourists this summer March 14, 2017, 5:19 pm The Fort’s owner Holly Arnold Kinney recently was inducted into the Denver and Colorado Tourism Hall of Fame, but it is not a sign she has slowed down; to the contrary, Kinney has big plans for The Fort this summer. Memories of Arnold Palmer everywhere at Bay Hill March 14, 2017, 5:03 pm There are sure to be somber moments at the Arnold Palmer Invitational this week. That 13-foot bronze statue of Palmer behind the first tee at Bay Hill was attracting plenty of attention Tuesday. The cart that Palmer used to drive, with two sets of clubs strapped on the back, will be behind the 16th tee starting Wednesday. Massive, mixed-use community planned for Aurora Aerotropolis site, could house 60,000 people March 14, 2017, 5:02 pm A 2,900-acre community of homes, parks, offices and shopping districts could start taking shape this year on the vacant plains of east Aurora, pending approvals from local lawmakers. SEC wants federal court of appeals to rethink ruling that questions administrative proceedings March 14, 2017, 4:46 pm The federal government has asked the entire bench of justices at the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals in Denver to re-decide an earlier ruling that, if left to stand, could nullify hundreds of decisions made in securities cases from Colorado and five other states.
